availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Fitzgerald (Henry County, Kentucky, tailor, jailer, and merchant.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, tailor, jailer, and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah D. Stewart Fitzgerald. Father of John A. Fitzgerald, Sarah D. Fitzgerald, Lucretia C. Fitzgerald, Henry G. Fitzgerald, Joseph B. Fitzgerald, and Winfield Fitzgerald. Tailor in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Jailer in Henry County. Merchant in Henry County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 364A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, New Castle, p. 242.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, New Castle, p. 198B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Henry County Births.
Journal of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Begun and Held in the Town of Frankfort, on Monday, the Second Day of September, in the Year of Our Lord 1861, and of the Commonwealth the Seventh (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, 1861), 250.
